headline: Streetleaf is Now Illuminating South Carolina
summary: 32 Solar-Powered Streetlights are Installed in Ridgeland Streetleaf, the leading provider of solar-powered streetlight services in the United States, today announced that the company now has a footprint in South Carolina. Streetleaf has installed 32 solar-powered lights in The Groves at Bees Creek by D.R. Horton. Each light is designed for performance, resilience, and sustainability. The lights are DarkSky compliant, fully off-grid, and powered by 100% renewable energy, meaning they stay on even

content.title: Streetleaf is Now Illuminating South Carolina
content.summary: 32 Solar-Powered Streetlights are Installed in Ridgeland Streetleaf, the leading provider of solar-powered streetlight services in the United States, today announced that the company now has a footprint in South Carolina. Streetleaf has installed 32 solar-powered lights in The Groves at Bees Creek by D.R. Horton. Each light is designed for performance, resilience, and sustainability. The lights are DarkSky compliant, fully off-grid, and powered by 100% renewable energy, meaning they stay on even

thumbnail.caption: Streetleaf has installed 32 solar-powered lights in The Groves at Bees Creek by D.R. Horton. Each light is designed for performance, resilience, and sustainability. The lights are DarkSky compliant, fully off-grid, and powered by 100% renewable energy, meaning they stay on even during power outages. Engineered to withstand winds up to 160 mph, the lights are built for long-term reliability. Streetleaf will continue to expand its footprint in South Carolina over the coming months.
